channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Monolith: Real Time Recommendation System With Collisionless Embedding Table
item.description: In this paper, we present Monolith, a system tailored for online training.

item.title: Automating the Search for Artificial Life with Foundation Models
item.description: With the recent Nobel Prize awarded for radical advances in protein discovery, foundation models (FMs) for exploring large combinatorial spaces promise to revolutionize many scientific fields.

item.title: Arbitrary-steps Image Super-resolution via Diffusion Inversion
item.description: This study presents a new image super-resolution (SR) technique based on diffusion inversion, aiming at harnessing the rich image priors encapsulated in large pre-trained diffusion models to improve SR performance.

item.title: CLEAR: Conv-Like Linearization Revs Pre-Trained Diffusion Transformers Up
item.description: Diffusion Transformers (DiT) have become a leading architecture in image generation.

item.title: Smarter, Better, Faster, Longer: A Modern Bidirectional Encoder for Fast, Memory Efficient, and Long Context Finetuning and Inference
item.description: Encoder-only transformer models such as BERT offer a great performance-size tradeoff for retrieval and classification tasks with respect to larger decoder-only models.

item.title: Dora: Sampling and Benchmarking for 3D Shape Variational Auto-Encoders
item.description: However, the widely adopted uniform point sampling strategy in Shape VAE training often leads to a significant loss of geometric details, limiting the quality of shape reconstruction and downstream generation tasks.

item.title: DisPose: Disentangling Pose Guidance for Controllable Human Image Animation
item.description: Specifically, we generate a dense motion field from a sparse motion field and the reference image, which provides region-level dense guidance while maintaining the generalization of the sparse pose control.

item.title: Thinking in Space: How Multimodal Large Language Models See, Remember, and Recall Spaces
item.description: Humans possess the visual-spatial intelligence to remember spaces from sequential visual observations.

item.title: Large Concept Models: Language Modeling in a Sentence Representation Space
item.description: In this paper, we present an attempt at an architecture which operates on an explicit higher-level semantic representation, which we name a concept.

item.title: On the Measure of Intelligence
item.description: To make deliberate progress towards more intelligent and more human-like artificial systems, we need to be following an appropriate feedback signal: we need to be able to define and evaluate intelligence in a way that enables comparisons between two systems, as well as comparisons with humans.

item.title: OpenEMMA: Open-Source Multimodal Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: Furthermore, OpenEMMA demonstrates effectiveness, generalizability, and robustness across a variety of challenging driving scenarios, offering a more efficient and effective approach to autonomous driving.

item.title: DRT-o1: Optimized Deep Reasoning Translation via Long Chain-of-Thought
item.description: To simulate LLMs' long thought ability in MT, we first mine sentences containing similes or metaphors from existing literature books, and then develop a multi-agent framework to translate these sentences via long thought.

item.title: KAG: Boosting LLMs in Professional Domains via Knowledge Augmented Generation
item.description: The recently developed retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) technology has enabled the efficient construction of domain-specific applications.

item.title: Learning Flow Fields in Attention for Controllable Person Image Generation
item.description: Additionally, we show that our loss is model-agnostic and can be used to improve the performance of other diffusion models.

item.title: Lyra: An Efficient and Speech-Centric Framework for Omni-Cognition
item.description: As Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) evolve, expanding beyond single-domain capabilities is essential to meet the demands for more versatile and efficient AI.

item.title: Autoregressive Video Generation without Vector Quantization
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach that enables autoregressive video generation with high efficiency.

item.title: Cross-View Referring Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: It introduces the cross-view to obtain the appearances of objects from multiple views, avoiding the problem of the invisible appearances of objects in RMOT task.

item.title: Offline Reinforcement Learning for LLM Multi-Step Reasoning
item.description: While Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) has shown promise in aligning LLMs with human preferences, it is less suitable for multi-step reasoning tasks because (1) DPO relies on paired preference data, which is not readily available for multi-step reasoning tasks, and (2) it treats all tokens uniformly, making it ineffective for credit assignment in multi-step reasoning tasks, which often come with sparse reward.

item.title: Allegro: Open the Black Box of Commercial-Level Video Generation Model
item.description: Significant advancements have been made in the field of video generation, with the open-source community contributing a wealth of research papers and tools for training high-quality models.

item.title: Imitate, Explore, and Self-Improve: A Reproduction Report on Slow-thinking Reasoning Systems
item.description: We introduce an ``imitate, explore, and self-improve'' framework, denoted as \textbf{STILL-2}, as our primary technical approach to train the reasoning model.
